Job Title: Maintenance Manager

Location: Janesville, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Employment Type: Full-time Available Positions: 1 Location: On-SiteApplication Deadline: April 9th, 2024 Summary  The Maintenance Manager will be responsible for planning, directing, and monitoring preventative and corrective maintenance and repair activities to ensure the Company’s buildings, facilities, machinery, and equipment operate reliably and efficiently. Additionally, this role manages and directs capital improvement projects such as equipment upgrades and new installations Key Activities  Assures the safe execution of all maintenance and utility activities while driving the Maintenance function and department to meet regulatory guidelines such as OSHA, SQF, and GMP.Responsible for plant maintenance including facilities, utilities, and operations to reduce downtime, drive operational efficiencies and help assure peak plant performance.Partners or directs capital projects such as equipment installations, upgrades, and major facility shutdown events, including scheduling and working with appropriate outside vendors.Manages and oversees department expenditures to ensure cost-effective purchasing practices are established and adhered to.Optimizes the efficient and safe operation of production assets through appropriate predictive and preventative maintenance and safe and effective execution of corrective maintenance and projects.Coordinates major maintenance and project requirements with internal stakeholders to included downtime activities and downtime periods.Trains/mentors maintenance staff on effective maintenance practices, troubleshooting techniques, and problem-solving tools to heighten department capabilities and increase production efficiencies.Sets and evaluates departmental goals and objectives and motivates/leads team towards achievement.Identifies and ensures critical parts availability to minimize equipment downtime while balancing economic maintenance inventory management.Helps ensure everyone’s safety through the aggressive completion of safety-related work orders and enforcement of factory safety regulations such as lock out/tag out.Manages and evaluates the Maintenance staff including performance management, employee improvement, and employee development
Preferred Skills   Working knowledge of OSHA, SQF, and GMP requirements for food processing facilities.Strong leadership and communication skills are required, coupled with an orientation toward continuous improvement. Educations & Experience 
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related discipline preferred or equivalent work experience.5 - 8 plus years of industrial maintenance experience- food industry experience preferred.Five plus years of supervisory and managerial experience. Are you looking for your next opportunity? We can help.   Finding a great opportunity that fosters growth, a great culture, and leadership opportunities can be difficult. Top Quality Recruitment (TQR) connects professionals with leadership opportunities across the Packaging, Food and Beverage, Medical Devices, and Biotechnology industries. With 50+ years of experience, we believe in one-to-one communication and finding the best candidate/employer match possible. TQR is an equal opportunity employer that encourages diversity. We will consider all applications.  Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request.  Are you looking to hire? Get started here:https://www.topqualityrecruitment.com/fill-a-position/  See hiring advice: https://www.topqualityrecruitment.com/blog/  See all available opportunities: https://www.topqualityrecruitment.com/jobs/  We thank all applicants for their interest and appreciate the time and effort involved; however, due to the large volume of resumes received only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Please attached your resume to your application.   Job ID: 7169

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Optimizes the efficient and safe operation of production assets through appropriate maintenance practices.
Coordinates major maintenance and project requirements with internal stakeholders.
Trains/mentors maintenance staff on effective maintenance practices, troubleshooting techniques, and problem-solving tools.
Sets and evaluates departmental goals and objectives and motivates/leads team towards achievement.
